nnciSystemTable.name: nnciSystemTable
nnciSystemTable.description: This table contains interesting general information about the managed element in its entirety

nnciSystemTableEntry.name: nnciSystemTableEntry
nnciSystemTableEntry.description: A list of general information about the managed element

nnciSystemDate.name: nnciSystemDate
nnciSystemDate.description: The current date as known by the node.The date is formatted as a sequence of nine ASCII characters in the form DD-MMM-YY, where DD is the day of the month (01..31), MMM is the month of the year, e.g. JAN, and YY is the last two digits of the year, e.g. 90.

nnciSystemProductName.name: nnciSystemProductName
nnciSystemProductName.description: The marketing name for the product, e.g. 8230 MainStreet for something if sysObjectId.0 = nnci8230

nnciSystemGeneric.name: nnciSystemGeneric
nnciSystemGeneric.description: This object identifies the revision of the firmware in the standard Newbridge fashion. The identifier is a string of 10 ASCII characters of the form M11D-HL-PP where: D indicates the release number of the software LL indicates the load of the software, and PP indicates the patch-level of the firmware.

nnciSystemNVMAllocation.name: nnciSystemNVMAllocation
nnciSystemNVMAllocation.description: This object provides status information about the non-volatile memory present on the main card of the system. The information returned includes the size of a single block of NVM, the total number of blocks available for use, the number of bad blocks and the number of blocks in use.

nnciSystemNVMRepairInfo.name: nnciSystemNVMRepairInfo
nnciSystemNVMRepairInfo.description: This object returns the details of the latest repair performed on the non-volatile memory present on the main card.

nnciSystemTime.name: nnciSystemTime
nnciSystemTime.description: The current time of day including seconds. The time is represented as a sequence of 9 ASCII characters in the form HH:MM:SS, where HH is the hour of the day (0..12), MM is the minute of the hour and SS are the seconds of the minute (0..59)

nnciSerialPortTable.name: nnciSerialPortTable
nnciSerialPortTable.description: This table contains the configuration information for an asynchronous management port for a standalone node.

nnciSerialPortTableEntry.name: nnciSerialPortTableEntry
nnciSerialPortTableEntry.description: A list of configuration information for a management port on a standalone node

nnciSpBaudRate.name: nnciSpBaudRate
nnciSpBaudRate.description: The baud rate of the asynchronous management port.

nnciSpWordLength.name: nnciSpWordLength
nnciSpWordLength.description: The word length used on the asynchronous management port.

nnciSpStopBits.name: nnciSpStopBits
nnciSpStopBits.description: The number of stop bits used by the asynchronous management port.

nnciSpParity.name: nnciSpParity
nnciSpParity.description: The parity used on the asynchronous management port.

nnciAlarmTable.name: nnciAlarmTable
nnciAlarmTable.description: This table contains all the configuration and status information about the alarm mechanism along with the alarms themselves.

nnciAlarmTableEntry.name: nnciAlarmTableEntry
nnciAlarmTableEntry.description: A list of all of the configuration and status information for a node, along with the alarm queues themselves.

nnciAlarmCount.name: nnciAlarmCount
nnciAlarmCount.description: The number of alarms in the specified queue.

nnciAlarmQueueEntry.name: nnciAlarmQueueEntry
nnciAlarmQueueEntry.description: When read, this object returns the particulars of the entry in the specified queue.

nnciAlarmSeqNum.name: nnciAlarmSeqNum
nnciAlarmSeqNum.description: The next sequence number that will be used by the node. The sequence numbers are a unique, within a single node, identifier for an alarm.

nnciAlarmCodePriority.name: nnciAlarmCodePriority
nnciAlarmCodePriority.description: This value of this object controls into which queue an alarm is placed.

nnciAlarmDeleteQueueEntry.name: nnciAlarmDeleteQueueEntry
nnciAlarmDeleteQueueEntry.description: A set to this object is deletes the first N alarms from the specified alarm queue.

nnciAlarmQueueType.name: nnciAlarmQueueType
nnciAlarmQueueType.description: This paramater is used to control the behaviour of the alarm queue in the overlfow case, i.e. when the alarm facility attempts to place the 65th alarm into the queue. If the queue type is set to Fixed, the 65th and 64th alarms will be discarded and the 'Too Many Alarms' alarm added as the last entry in the queue. If the queue type is set to Circular, the 65th alarm will overwrite the first alarm in the queue

nnciDiagTable.name: nnciDiagTable
nnciDiagTable.description: This table contains all of the configuration and status information related to diagnostics on a node.

nnciDiagTableEntry.name: nnciDiagTableEntry
nnciDiagTableEntry.description: A list of all of the configuration and status information related to node diagnostics.

nnciDiagEnable.name: nnciDiagEnable
nnciDiagEnable.description: This object controls whether or not background diagnostics are run. If the object is set to 2 (enabled), then background diagnostics are run periodically. If the object is set to 1 (disabled), background diagnostics are not performed.

nnciDiagResults.name: nnciDiagResults
nnciDiagResults.description: This object indicates the results of power on and background diagnostics. Any bit that is asserted corresponds to a failure of a component of the card.

nnciNetSynchTable.name: nnciNetSynchTable
nnciNetSynchTable.description: This table contains all of the configuration and status information for the network synchronization mechanism for a standalone node.

nnciNetSynchTableEntry.name: nnciNetSynchTableEntry
nnciNetSynchTableEntry.description: A list of all of the configuration and status information related to network synchronization.

nnciNetSynchSourceStatus.name: nnciNetSynchSourceStatus
nnciNetSynchSourceStatus.description: This object returns the current status of the specified source of synchronization. A set to this object changes the enabled/disabled status of the source. If the source is disabled, writing anything other than 'Disabled' will cause the source to be enabled, and its state will change to one of Not Ready, Ready, or Current. If the source is enabled, writing 'Disabled' to this object will disable the source.

nnciNetSynchTimingSource.name: nnciNetSynchTimingSource
nnciNetSynchTimingSource.description: The device which provides timing when the specified source of synchronization is selected. The sync source must be disabled before changing this object.

nnciNetSynchReacquisitionMode.name: nnciNetSynchReacquisitionMode
nnciNetSynchReacquisitionMode.description: How the source of synchronization will be treated in the event a failure is detected. If Manual is selected, the source will remain unused until it is re-selected. If Automatic recovery is selected, the source will be returned to use as soon as it is valid, e.g. when a T1 link regains frame alignment. If Timed recovery is selected, the node will attempt to use the source at the specified interval.

nnciNetSynchCurrentSource.name: nnciNetSynchCurrentSource
nnciNetSynchCurrentSource.description: The current source of synchronization for the node. A set to this object toggles the ready/current status of the source. If the source is ready, it will become the current source. If the source is current, it will become ready, and the next-best source will become the current source. If the source is neither ready nor current, a set to this object has no effect.

nnciNetSynchRecoveryInterval.name: nnciNetSynchRecoveryInterval
nnciNetSynchRecoveryInterval.description: This object is used to set the interval between recovery attempts for a source of synchronization that is using Timed recovery in seconds.

nnciNetSynchQuality.name: nnciNetSynchQuality
nnciNetSynchQuality.description: This object is used to set the maximum permissible number of failures that can be experienced by a source in an hour. If this limit is exceeded, an alarm is raised and the source is placed into the disabled state.

nnciNetSynchSourceClass.name: nnciNetSynchSourceClass
nnciNetSynchSourceClass.description: This object is used to set the class of a source. The source with the best class will provide system sync when several sources are Ready. Note that the freerun source (source 5) does not actually make use of this object. It gets its class from nnciNetSynchNodeClass.

nnciNetSynchNodeClass.name: nnciNetSynchNodeClass
nnciNetSynchNodeClass.description: This object is used to set the class of the node. The node will freerun if the value of this object is lower than the nnciNetSynchSourceClass of the other sources.

nnciSlotTable.name: nnciSlotTable
nnciSlotTable.description: This table contains all of the common, slot configuration and status information for a standalone node

nnciSlotTableEntry.name: nnciSlotTableEntry
nnciSlotTableEntry.description: A list of all of the common, per-slot configuration and status information for a standalone node.

nnciSlotName.name: nnciSlotName
nnciSlotName.description: An arbitrary name for a slot.

nnciSlotProgType.name: nnciSlotProgType
nnciSlotProgType.description: This object is used to specify what kind of module should be present in the specified position . If the value in this object does not match the value in the nnciSlotPresType object, then the position will be held out of service.

nnciSlotPresType.name: nnciSlotPresType
nnciSlotPresType.description: This object is used to specify what kind of module is present in the specified position . If the value of this object does not match the value of the nnciSlotProgType object, the position will be held out of service.

nnciSlotStatus.name: nnciSlotStatus
nnciSlotStatus.description: This object contains the current status of the specified position . The status reflects whether a module is present, and if so, is it of the expected type.

nnciSlotModuleID.name: nnciSlotModuleID
nnciSlotModuleID.description: The hardware identification number assigned to the module that is present in the specified position. If there is no module installed in the position, the value returned will be 0 (zero). Note that this identification number identifies what kind of module is present; the revision level of the module is available in the nnciSlotHardwareRevision object

nnciSlotSubModuleProgType.name: nnciSlotSubModuleProgType
nnciSlotSubModuleProgType.description: What kind of 'sub-module' should be present in the specified slot. If the value in this object does not match the value in the nnciSlotModulePresType object, then the position will be held out of service. Any attempt to set this object for other than the expansion module positions will be rejected.

nnciSlotSubModulePresType.name: nnciSlotSubModulePresType
nnciSlotSubModulePresType.description: What kind of 'sub-module' is present in the specified position. If the value of this object does not match the value of the nnciSlotModuleProgType object, the position will be held out of service.

nnciSlotFirmwareID.name: nnciSlotFirmwareID
nnciSlotFirmwareID.description: The revision level of the firmware, if any, that is present on a module. If no firmware is present, the value will be zero.

nnciSlotBusyOut.name: nnciSlotBusyOut
nnciSlotBusyOut.description: This object is used to take circuits on a specified slot out of service. If the value of this object is hold-out-of-service, then the circuits on the slot will not be used even if all alarms are cleared and the circuits would normally be placed into service. If the value of this object is normal, then the circuits will operate as if this object did not exist. If the circuits are the specified position are in service when the object is set, it will be immediately removed from service.

nnciSlotSubModuleID.name: nnciSlotSubModuleID
nnciSlotSubModuleID.description: The hardware identification number assigned to the sub-module that is present in the specified position. If there is no sub-module installed in the position, or no sub-module present, the value returned will be zero.

nnciSlotVariantID.name: nnciSlotVariantID
nnciSlotVariantID.description: The variant identification number for the module which is installed in the specified slot. If there is no module installed, the value returned will be zero.

nnciSlotResetCard.name: nnciSlotResetCard
nnciSlotResetCard.description: This object is used to cause the node to re-initialize the specified module. Any set to this object will cause the specified module to be re-initialized. If a set is attempted with the modifier set to select the main card, the whole node will be reset. A get on this object will always return zero.

nnciSlotHardwareRevision.name: nnciSlotHardwareRevision
nnciSlotHardwareRevision.description: The engineering revision level of the module that occupies the specified position. The high nibble of the returned value is the major revision level and the low nibble is the minor revision, e.g. Engineering Revision 21 will be returned as $21.

nnciT1SlotTable.name: nnciT1SlotTable
nnciT1SlotTable.description: This table contains all of the configuration and status information for a T1 interface.

nnciT1SlotTableEntry.name: nnciT1SlotTableEntry
nnciT1SlotTableEntry.description: A list of all of the configuration and status information for a T1 interface.

nnciT1SlotAlarmControl.name: nnciT1SlotAlarmControl
nnciT1SlotAlarmControl.description: This object can be used to control the alarm condition that is indicated by the specified interface. If ForceYellow is selected, the interface will provide the same indication to the far end as if the local interface had lost frame. If ForceAIS is selected, the interface will transmit an unframed all ones signal towards the far end.

nnciT1SlotFramingStyle.name: nnciT1SlotFramingStyle
nnciT1SlotFramingStyle.description: This object is used to select either D4 or ESF framing for the T1 link.

nnciT1SlotZeroSuppression.name: nnciT1SlotZeroSuppression
nnciT1SlotZeroSuppression.description: This object is used to select the kind, if any, of zero-code suppression to be used on the link.

nnciT1SlotLinkStatus.name: nnciT1SlotLinkStatus
nnciT1SlotLinkStatus.description: This object returns the current 'alarm' state of the T1 facility.

nnciT1SlotLoopLength.name: nnciT1SlotLoopLength
nnciT1SlotLoopLength.description: This object is used to control the pre-equalization applied to signal before transmission.

nnciT1SlotThreshold.name: nnciT1SlotThreshold
nnciT1SlotThreshold.description: This object controls the system's tolerance of failures on the specified T1 link. If more than the specified number of failures occurs in one hour, the interface will be removed from consideration as a source of synchronization. A failure is defined as the occurrence of an alarm condition on the interface, i.e. one that results in any bits other than 0 (zero) or 9 (nine) being set in the nnciT1SlotLinkStatus object.

nnciT1SlotLoopback.name: nnciT1SlotLoopback
nnciT1SlotLoopback.description: This object is used to set or remove loopbacks on the T1 link

nnciT1SlotTrunkConditioningEnable.name: nnciT1SlotTrunkConditioningEnable
nnciT1SlotTrunkConditioningEnable.description: This object controls when trunk-conditioning is applied to the specified T1 link. Trunk- conditioning is the process by which all of the connections to the link are temporarily broken and a known pattern is sent on each channel of the T1.

nnciT1SlotAlarmDeclarationTime.name: nnciT1SlotAlarmDeclarationTime
nnciT1SlotAlarmDeclarationTime.description: This object controls the interval for which the local loss-of-frame condition is debounced. The debounce algorithm and default value correspond to the requirements of AT&T PUB 62411.

nnciT1SlotAlarmClearingTime.name: nnciT1SlotAlarmClearingTime
nnciT1SlotAlarmClearingTime.description: This object controls the interval for which the reacquisition of local frame is debounced. The debounce algorithm and default value correspond to the requirements of AT&T PUB 62411.

nnciT1SlotCRCFraming.name: nnciT1SlotCRCFraming
nnciT1SlotCRCFraming.description: This object controls whether a Cyclic Redundancy Check is used when the specified T1 link reframes. This is only applicable to T1 links that a programmed for ESF operation.

nnciE1SlotTable.name: nnciE1SlotTable
nnciE1SlotTable.description: This table contains all of the configuration and status information for a E1 interface

nnciE1SlotTableEntry.name: nnciE1SlotTableEntry
nnciE1SlotTableEntry.description: A list of all of the configuration and status information for a E1 interface.

nnciE1SlotAlarmControl.name: nnciE1SlotAlarmControl
nnciE1SlotAlarmControl.description: This object can be used to control the alarm condition that is indicated by the specified interface. If ForceAISInTS16 is selected, the interface will transmit a continuous all ones pattern in TS16 of the E1 link. If ForceAISAllTS is selected, the interface will transmit an un-framed 'all ones' signal on the interface.

nnciE1SlotLoopback.name: nnciE1SlotLoopback
nnciE1SlotLoopback.description: This object is used to set or remove loopbacks on the E1 interface.

nnciE1SlotSignalling.name: nnciE1SlotSignalling
nnciE1SlotSignalling.description: This object is used to select either Common Channel Signalling (CCS) or Channel Associated Signalling (CAS) operation for the interface. CCS operation makes timeslot 16 of the E1 link available for user data . 31CHAN mode allows TS16 to be used for super-rate data, whereas CCS does not. In CAS operation, timeslot 16 is used to transfer ABCD bit signalling and thus is not available to carry user data.

nnciE1SlotShieldLevel.name: nnciE1SlotShieldLevel
nnciE1SlotShieldLevel.description: This object is used to control the level of the coax shield at the E1 physical interface for each of the receive and transmit lines. The two shields (receive and transmit) can be controlled independently.

nnciE1SlotLinkStatus.name: nnciE1SlotLinkStatus
nnciE1SlotLinkStatus.description: This object returns the current 'alarm' state of the E1 interface.

nnciE1SlotThreshold.name: nnciE1SlotThreshold
nnciE1SlotThreshold.description: This object controls the system's tolerance of failures on the specified interface. If more than the specified number of failures occurs in one hour, the interface will be removed from consideration as a source of synchronization. A failure is defined as the occurrence of an alarm condition on the interface, i.e. one that results in any bits other than 0 (zero) or 9 (nine) being set in the nnciE1SlotLinkStatus object.

nnciE1TypeOfStats.name: nnciE1TypeOfStats
nnciE1TypeOfStats.description: The type of stats to be collected for this E1 link.

nnciE1SlotTrunkConditioningEnable.name: nnciE1SlotTrunkConditioningEnable
nnciE1SlotTrunkConditioningEnable.description: This object controls when trunk-conditioning is applied to the specified interface. Trunk- conditioning is the process by which all of the connections to the interface are temporarily broken and a known pattern is sent on each channel of the interface.

nnciE1SlotAlarmDeclarationTime.name: nnciE1SlotAlarmDeclarationTime
nnciE1SlotAlarmDeclarationTime.description: This object controls the interval for which the local loss-of-frame condition is debounced.

nnciE1SlotAlarmClearingTime.name: nnciE1SlotAlarmClearingTime
nnciE1SlotAlarmClearingTime.description: This object controls the interval for which the reacquisition of local frame is debounced.

nnciE1SlotCRCFraming.name: nnciE1SlotCRCFraming
nnciE1SlotCRCFraming.description: This object controls the generation and use of a Cyclic Redundancy Check during reframing.

nnciDevTable.name: nnciDevTable
nnciDevTable.description: This table contains all of the common, per-device configuration and status information for a circuit. Device-type specific information is found in other tables as appropriate.

nnciDevTableEntry.name: nnciDevTableEntry
nnciDevTableEntry.description: A list of all of the common, per-device configuration and status information.

nnciDevName.name: nnciDevName
nnciDevName.description: A user-defined name for the specified circuit.

nnciDevLoopback.name: nnciDevLoopback
nnciDevLoopback.description: This object is used to apply and remove loopbacks on the specified circuit. Note that it may not be possible to apply loopbacks to some circuit types.

nnciDevMateDevice.name: nnciDevMateDevice
nnciDevMateDevice.description: The device number of the device, if any, that is cross-connected to the device of interest. If there is no programmed connection, the device number will be zero.

nnciDevSetShowSig.name: nnciDevSetShowSig
nnciDevSetShowSig.description: A get from this object will return the current value of signalling, as appropriate for the type of the specified device. When set, the bit pattern supplied will be used as the signalling that is being sent by the circuit.

nnciDevReady.name: nnciDevReady
nnciDevReady.description: Whether or not the circuit is ready for use.

nnciDevActive.name: nnciDevActive
nnciDevActive.description: Whether or not the circuit is active.

nnciDevConnected.name: nnciDevConnected
nnciDevConnected.description: Whether or not the circuit is connected.

nnciDevOutOfService.name: nnciDevOutOfService
nnciDevOutOfService.description: Whether or not the circuit has detected an OutOfService condition.

nnciDevUnderMaintenance.name: nnciDevUnderMaintenance
nnciDevUnderMaintenance.description: True iff the circuit has been subject to a maintenance operation, e.g. a loopback.

nnciDevBusyOut.name: nnciDevBusyOut
nnciDevBusyOut.description: This object is used to remove a circuit from service.

nnciDevFailed.name: nnciDevFailed
nnciDevFailed.description: True iff this circuit has failed a diagnostics test.

nnciDevDiagEnable.name: nnciDevDiagEnable
nnciDevDiagEnable.description: Whether or not background diagnostics are enabled for this circuit (if applicable).

nnciT1Table.name: nnciT1Table
nnciT1Table.description: This table contains all of the configuration and status information for a T1 circuit

nnciT1TableEntry.name: nnciT1TableEntry
nnciT1TableEntry.description: A list of all of the configuration and status information for an T1 circuit

nnciT1BusyOut.name: nnciT1BusyOut
nnciT1BusyOut.description: What action will be taken on the circuit when the circuit is not connected.

nnciT1RobbedBitSig.name: nnciT1RobbedBitSig
nnciT1RobbedBitSig.description: This object is used to enable or disable Robbed-Bit Signalling for the circuit.

nnciT1Inversion.name: nnciT1Inversion
nnciT1Inversion.description: Whether or not data transmitted on this circuit is inverted.

nnciT1DefaultData.name: nnciT1DefaultData
nnciT1DefaultData.description: The value that is to be transmitted on the circuit when it is not connected.

nnciT1FirstCode.name: nnciT1FirstCode
nnciT1FirstCode.description: The nnciT1FirstCode object is one of two which determines the signalling that will be sent during the Trunk-Conditioning process. This object determines the signalling that will be sent during a timed-break, if one is applied.

nnciT1SecondCode.name: nnciT1SecondCode
nnciT1SecondCode.description: The nnciT1SecondCode object is the second of two objects which determines the signalling that will be sent during the Trunk-Conditioning process. This object determines the signalling that will be sent for the duration of the trunk-conditioning process, following the timed-break.

nnciT1PartOfSuperRate.name: nnciT1PartOfSuperRate
nnciT1PartOfSuperRate.description: This parameter is used to form a circular linked list of circuit numbers which make up a superrate connection It contains the circuit number of the next circuit in the superrate connection or zero if the circuit is not part of a super-rate group

nnciT1BitsUsed.name: nnciT1BitsUsed
nnciT1BitsUsed.description: A bitmap which indicates which bits of the T1 circuit are to be used for data.

nnciT1SuperRateCircuitMap.name: nnciT1SuperRateCircuitMap
nnciT1SuperRateCircuitMap.description: When written to, this object builds the circularly-linked list of circuits represented by the one bits in the value written. When read, this object returns the bit map corresponding to the super-rate group of which this circuit is a member

nnciT1SuperRateNumCircuits.name: nnciT1SuperRateNumCircuits
nnciT1SuperRateNumCircuits.description: When written to, this object builds the circularly-linked list of circuits to represent the super-rate group which begins at this circuit and contains the specified number of circuits. When read, this object returns the number of circuits in the super-rate group of which this circuit is a member

nnciE1Table.name: nnciE1Table
nnciE1Table.description: This table contains all of the configuration and status information for a E1 circuit

nnciE1TableEntry.name: nnciE1TableEntry
nnciE1TableEntry.description: A list of all of the configuration and status information for an E1 circuit

nnciE1BusyOut.name: nnciE1BusyOut
nnciE1BusyOut.description: What signalling will be transmitted on the circuit when the circuit is not connected.

nnciE1AlternateDigitInversion.name: nnciE1AlternateDigitInversion
nnciE1AlternateDigitInversion.description: Whether or not Alternate Digit Inversion (ADI) will be applied to the data transmitted and received on the circuit.

nnciE1DefaultData.name: nnciE1DefaultData
nnciE1DefaultData.description: The value that is to be transmitted on the circuit when it is not connected.

nnciE1FirstCode.name: nnciE1FirstCode
nnciE1FirstCode.description: The nnciE1FirstCode object is one of two which determines the signalling that will be sent during the Trunk-Conditioning process. This object determines the signalling that will be sent during a timed-break, if one is applied.

nnciE1SecondCode.name: nnciE1SecondCode
nnciE1SecondCode.description: The nnciE1SecondCode object is the second of two objects which determines the signalling that will be sent during the Trunk-Conditioning process. This object determines the signalling that will be sent for the duration of the trunk-conditioning process, following the timed-break.

nnciE1PartOfSuperRate.name: nnciE1PartOfSuperRate
nnciE1PartOfSuperRate.description: This parameter is used to form a circular linked list of circuit numbers which make up a superrate connection. It contains the circuit number of the next circuit in the superrate connection or zero if the circuit is not part of a super-rate group.

nnciE1BitsUsed.name: nnciE1BitsUsed
nnciE1BitsUsed.description: A bitmap which indicates which bits of the E1 circuit are to be used for data.

nnciE1SuperRateCircuitMap.name: nnciE1SuperRateCircuitMap
nnciE1SuperRateCircuitMap.description: When written to, this object builds the circularly-linked list of circuits represented by the one bits in the value written. When read, this object returns the bit map corresponding to the super-rate group of which this circuit is a member

nnciE1SuperRateNumCircuits.name: nnciE1SuperRateNumCircuits
nnciE1SuperRateNumCircuits.description: When written to, this object builds the circularly-linked list of circuits to represent the super-rate group which begins at this circuit and contains the specified number of circuits. When read, this object returns the number of circuits in the super-rate group of which this circuit is a member.

nnciSdcTable.name: nnciSdcTable
nnciSdcTable.description: This table contains all of the configuration and status information for a Synchronous Data Module circuit.

nnciSdcTableEntry.name: nnciSdcTableEntry
nnciSdcTableEntry.description: A list of all of the configuration and status information required for a Synchronous Data Module circuit.

nnciSdcInterfaceControl.name: nnciSdcInterfaceControl
nnciSdcInterfaceControl.description: Determines the gender (DTE/DCE) of the specified circuit. The gender is used to a) control the operation and interpretation of the control leads and determine the source of clocks for the interface.

nnciSdcInterfaceSpeed.name: nnciSdcInterfaceSpeed
nnciSdcInterfaceSpeed.description: This object determines the speed of the specified interface in multiples of 800 bits/s. When the interface is in Data Terminal Equipment (DTE) mode (see nnciSdcInterfaceControl), the interface will run at the speed of the supplied clocks, regardless of the value of this object.

nnciSdcLeadsDefaultOn.name: nnciSdcLeadsDefaultOn
nnciSdcLeadsDefaultOn.description: This controls the state of the control leads on the specified interface. The control leads that are affected by this object are determined by a) the type of the interface and b) the mode (or gender) of the interface. The leads specified by this object are asserted towards the attached equipment. If there is a conflict between the leads that are 'defaulted on' and those that are 'defaulted off', the value of this object is taken to be correct.

nnciSdcLeadDefaultOff.name: nnciSdcLeadDefaultOff
nnciSdcLeadDefaultOff.description: The interface control leads specified by this object are de-asserted towards the attached equipment.

nnciSdcInterfaceStatus.name: nnciSdcInterfaceStatus
nnciSdcInterfaceStatus.description: This object reports the current status of the control leads associated with the specified interface. The meanings of the bits reported by this object depend on the type and gender of the interface.

nnciHdlcTable.name: nnciHdlcTable
nnciHdlcTable.description: This table contains all of the configuration, status and statistical information required for an HDLC circuit.

nnciHdlcTableEntry.name: nnciHdlcTableEntry
nnciHdlcTableEntry.description: A list of all of the configuration, status and statistical information required for an HDLC circuit.

nnciHdlcBytesTransmitted.name: nnciHdlcBytesTransmitted
nnciHdlcBytesTransmitted.description: A count of data and padding bytes that were successfully transmitted.

nnciHdlcFramesTransmitted.name: nnciHdlcFramesTransmitted
nnciHdlcFramesTransmitted.description: The number of frames that were successfully transmitted.

nnciHdlcRxGoodBytes.name: nnciHdlcRxGoodBytes
nnciHdlcRxGoodBytes.description: The number of bytes in frames that were successfully received.

nnciHdlcRxGoodFrames.name: nnciHdlcRxGoodFrames
nnciHdlcRxGoodFrames.description: The number of frames that were successfully received.

nnciHdlcUnderrun.name: nnciHdlcUnderrun
nnciHdlcUnderrun.description: The number of frames that should have been transmitted by the station, but could not be transmitted due to an internal MAC sublayer transmit error.

nnciHdlcCRCError.name: nnciHdlcCRCError
nnciHdlcCRCError.description: The number of frames that contained an integral number of bytes but did not pass the frame sequence.

nnciHdlcAlignmentError.name: nnciHdlcAlignmentError
nnciHdlcAlignmentError.description: The number of frames that did not contain an integral number of bytes and did not pass the frame sequence.

nnciHdlcOverrun.name: nnciHdlcOverrun
nnciHdlcOverrun.description: The number of frames which should have been received by the station, but could not be accepted due to an internal MAC sublayer receive error.

nnciHdlcAbort.name: nnciHdlcAbort
nnciHdlcAbort.description: The number of the number of times that a minimum of seven consecutive ones was received during frame reception.

nnciHdlcSinceLastReset.name: nnciHdlcSinceLastReset
nnciHdlcSinceLastReset.description: This object indicates the elapsed time in hundredths of a second since the HDLC device's statistical counters were last reset.

nnciHdlcApplication.name: nnciHdlcApplication
nnciHdlcApplication.description: This object indicates the elapsed time in hundredths of a second since the HDLC device's statistical counters were last reset.

nnciBridgeTable.name: nnciBridgeTable
nnciBridgeTable.description: This table contains all of the configuration information for a Bridge.

nnciBridgeTableEntry.name: nnciBridgeTableEntry
nnciBridgeTableEntry.description: A list of all of the configuration information required for a Bridge.

nnciBrdgAddress.name: nnciBrdgAddress
nnciBrdgAddress.description: The data-link layer address to which messages destined for the bridge should be sent.

nnciBrdgUptime.name: nnciBrdgUptime
nnciBrdgUptime.description: The elapsed time in hundredths of a second since the bridge entity was last reset.

nnciBrdgInterfaceCount.name: nnciBrdgInterfaceCount
nnciBrdgInterfaceCount.description: The number of interfaces which are programmed to be used for/by the bridge.

nnciBrdgMaxInterfaceCount.name: nnciBrdgMaxInterfaceCount
nnciBrdgMaxInterfaceCount.description: The maximum possible number of interfaces supported by the bridge.

nnciBrdgMapCircuitToInterface.name: nnciBrdgMapCircuitToInterface
nnciBrdgMapCircuitToInterface.description: Which interface the specified device belongs to.

nnciBrdgStFramesFiltered.name: nnciBrdgStFramesFiltered
nnciBrdgStFramesFiltered.description: The number of frames received by the bridge and discarded based on information in the address filter.

nnciBrdgStFramesForwarded.name: nnciBrdgStFramesForwarded
nnciBrdgStFramesForwarded.description: The number of frames received by the bridge, not discarded and forwarded to a single destination.

nnciBrdgStFramesFlooded.name: nnciBrdgStFramesFlooded
nnciBrdgStFramesFlooded.description: The number of frames received by the bridge, not discarded, but re-transmitted on all interfaces

nnciBrdgStTimeSinceLastReset.name: nnciBrdgStTimeSinceLastReset
nnciBrdgStTimeSinceLastReset.description: The elapsed time in hundredths of a second since the bridge's statistical counters were last reset.

nnciFilterTable.name: nnciFilterTable
nnciFilterTable.description: This table contains all of the configuration and status information related to the filtering mechanism of a Transparent Bridge.

nnciFilterTableEntry.name: nnciFilterTableEntry
nnciFilterTableEntry.description: A list of all of the configuration and status information related to the filtering mechanism of a Transparent Bridge.

nnciFilterReset.name: nnciFilterReset
nnciFilterReset.description: This object forces the bridge to reset the filtering database by first removing all of the entries from the filter and then re-initializing it with the entries from the permanent database. A get on this object will always return zero

nnciFilterLearn.name: nnciFilterLearn
nnciFilterLearn.description: This object determines whether the address filter will learn the source addresses of frames transmitted on networks to which it is directly attached.

nnciFilterPermDBChange.name: nnciFilterPermDBChange
nnciFilterPermDBChange.description: This object indicates that the permanent database entries have changed since the last filter reset.

nnciFilterPermDBMaxEntries.name: nnciFilterPermDBMaxEntries
nnciFilterPermDBMaxEntries.description: This object indicates the maximum number of entries that may be placed in the permanent database of the bridge.

nnciFilterPermDBEntryCount.name: nnciFilterPermDBEntryCount
nnciFilterPermDBEntryCount.description: This object returns the number of entries currently in the permanent database.

nnciFilterPermDBContents.name: nnciFilterPermDBContents
nnciFilterPermDBContents.description: This object provides access to the contents of the permanent database. The modifier is the entry number which can range from 1 to FILTER-PermDBEntryCount. If an attempt is made to access an entry that is not defined, an error will be returned.

nnciFilterAddPermDBEntry.name: nnciFilterAddPermDBEntry
nnciFilterAddPermDBEntry.description: This object provides a way to add an entry to the permanent database of the bridge. If the maximum size of the permanent database is exceeded, an error will be returned.

nnciFilterDeletePermDBEntry.name: nnciFilterDeletePermDBEntry
nnciFilterDeletePermDBEntry.description: This object provides a way to delete an entry from the permanent database of the bridge. If the specified entry does not exist, an error will be returned.

nnciFilterAFMaxEntries.name: nnciFilterAFMaxEntries
nnciFilterAFMaxEntries.description: This object stores the maximum number of entries that may be placed in the address filter. The number includes both entries copied from the permanent database and learned entries.

nnciFilterAFEntryLifetime.name: nnciFilterAFEntryLifetime
nnciFilterAFEntryLifetime.description: This object determined the lifetime of an entry in the address filter. Any entry that is present in the filter but not repeated within n nnciFilterAFEntryLifetime will be deleted from the filter. If the Spanning Tree Protocol is used, TBD this value of STP-ForwardDelay used to age the filter entries.

nnciFilterAFEntryCount.name: nnciFilterAFEntryCount
nnciFilterAFEntryCount.description: This object returns the number of entries currently in the address filter. This can be used in conjunction with nnciFilterAFContents to obtain the current contents of the address filter.

nnciFilterAFContents.name: nnciFilterAFContents
nnciFilterAFContents.description: This object provides access tot he current contents of the address filter.

nnciFilterForwardMatrix.name: nnciFilterForwardMatrix
nnciFilterForwardMatrix.description: This object determines any restrictions on bridged traffic flow from a particular interface to all of the other interfaces. The restrictions are organized as a bit vector where the values are either permit or deny. The value of nnciFilterForwardMatrix [i,j] must be permit if any frame originating on interface i may be transmitted on interface j.

nnciFilterFloodUnicastMatrix.name: nnciFilterFloodUnicastMatrix
nnciFilterFloodUnicastMatrix.description: This object determines the handling of a unicast frame with an unrecognized destination. The bridge normally floods such frames on all interfaces except the one on which the frame was received. This object can be used to prevent frames being flooded onto specific interfaces. The restrictions are organized as a bit vector for each interface, where the values are either permit or deny.

nnciFilterTakeSnapShot.name: nnciFilterTakeSnapShot
nnciFilterTakeSnapShot.description: A set with a value of snapshot will make a copy of the address filter that can be accessed by gets from nnciFilterContents

nnciFilterFloodMulticastMatrix.name: nnciFilterFloodMulticastMatrix
nnciFilterFloodMulticastMatrix.description: This object determines the handling of a multicast frame with an unrecognized destination. The bridge normally floods such frames on all interfaces except the one on which the frame was received. This object can be used to prevent frames being flooded onto specific interfaces. The restrictions are organized as a bit vector for each interface, where the values are either permit or deny.

nnciFilterFloodBroadcastMatrix.name: nnciFilterFloodBroadcastMatrix
nnciFilterFloodBroadcastMatrix.description: This object determines the handling of a broadcast frame with an unrecognized destination. The bridge normally floods such frames on all interfaces except the one on which the frame was received. This object can be used to prevent frames being flooded onto specific interfaces. The restrictions are organized as a bit vector for each interface, where the values are either permit or deny.

nnciFilterPermNVDBContents.name: nnciFilterPermNVDBContents
nnciFilterPermNVDBContents.description: This object provides access to the permanent entries stored in NVM, it is used to provide a degree of indirection through the permanent entry vector necessary for minimal manipulation of the database during deletion of permanent entries.

nnciFilterDeleteAllPermEntries.name: nnciFilterDeleteAllPermEntries
nnciFilterDeleteAllPermEntries.description: This object provides a way to delete all permanent entries from the database in one operation.

nnciStpTable.name: nnciStpTable
nnciStpTable.description: This table contains all of the configuration and status information relating to the operation of the 802.1d Spanning Tree Protocol.

nnciStpTableEntry.name: nnciStpTableEntry
nnciStpTableEntry.description: A list of all of the configuration and status information relating to the operation of the 802.1d Spanning Tree Protocol.

nnciStpEnable.name: nnciStpEnable
nnciStpEnable.description: This object enables or disables the Spanning Tree Protocol. If the protocol is disabled, the bridge acts as a simple bridge, which routes packets based only on information in the address filter. Working without the Spanning Tree Protocol may lead to loops in the network topology and is not recommended. The remaining objects in this section are only defined when the Spanning Tree Protocol is enabled.

nnciStpBridgePriority.name: nnciStpBridgePriority
nnciStpBridgePriority.description: This object determines the role of the bridge in the spanning tree. It is used to decide which bridge in the network should be the root, which bridges should be active, and which bridges should operate in a standby mode. By changing the bridge priority, one can affect the configuration of the spanning tree. Bridges with smaller priority values are preferentially active i.e. smaller values indicate higher priorities. The bridge priority forms the upper two bytes of the bridge identifier used by the Spanning Tree Protocol.

nnciStpRoot.name: nnciStpRoot
nnciStpRoot.description: This object identifies the bridge that is the root of the spanning tree.

nnciStpRootPathCost.name: nnciStpRootPathCost
nnciStpRootPathCost.description: This cost of a path is the sum of the costs of the individual hops along the path to the root, where the cost of a hop is a user-assignable object usually related to the speed of the physical link (speed in Mbits/sec) - see also nnciStpInterfaceCost.

nnciStpRootInterface.name: nnciStpRootInterface
nnciStpRootInterface.description: This object indicates the interface currently used to send messages to the root bridge. It is chosen as the interface which provides the least-cost path to the root.

nnciStpMaxAge.name: nnciStpMaxAge
nnciStpMaxAge.description: This object defines the maximum permissible age in seconds of the configuration information held for each interface. If the information becomes older than nnciStpMaxAge, without being updated by another configuration message from the root bridge, it is discarded, and the bridge attempts to become the designated bridge for that link. In this way, failures of the root or other bridges are detected. (See also nnciStpMyMaxAge).

nnciStpHelloTime.name: nnciStpHelloTime
nnciStpHelloTime.description: This object is the value of the HelloTimer used by the root bridge. The present Spanning Tree protocol propogates this value, but the bridges never use it; they use nnciStpMyHelloTime instead.

nnciStpForwardDelay.name: nnciStpForwardDelay
nnciStpForwardDelay.description: This object defines the number of seconds that an interface is kept in the listening or learning state before being moved to the next state. If a topology change has been detected (i.e., nnciStpTopologyChange is true), then this value is also used as the maximum lifetime of entries in the address filter.

nnciStpMyMaxAge.name: nnciStpMyMaxAge
nnciStpMyMaxAge.description: This object is assigned to nnciStpMaxAge if this bridge becomes the root of the spanning tree.

nnciStpMyHelloTime.name: nnciStpMyHelloTime
nnciStpMyHelloTime.description: This object is the interval between transmission of configuration BPDUs (also called Hello messages) by the bridge. This object is also assigned to nnciStpHelloTime if this bridge becomes the root of the Spanning Tree.

nnciStpMyForwardDelay.name: nnciStpMyForwardDelay
nnciStpMyForwardDelay.description: This object is assigned to nnciStpForwardDelay if this bridge becomes the root of the Spanning Tree.

nnciStpTopologyChangeDetected.name: nnciStpTopologyChangeDetected
nnciStpTopologyChangeDetected.description: If this object is true, then this bridge has detected a topology change recently and is sending topology change notifications (TCNs) to the root bridge.

nnciStpSendingTopologyChange.name: nnciStpSendingTopologyChange
nnciStpSendingTopologyChange.description: If this object is true, then the bridge has recently received a configuration BPDU with the topology change flag set. This indicates that the bridge has been notified (or has itself detected) a topology change, and all bridges in the network should use nnciStpForwardDelay as the aging time of entries in the filtering database for as long as the flag is set.

nnciStpTimeSinceLastTopologyChange.name: nnciStpTimeSinceLastTopologyChange
nnciStpTimeSinceLastTopologyChange.description: This object provides the elapsed time in seconds since the last change in network topology. This object is set to zero when a bridge reset occurs.

nnciStpTopologyChanges.name: nnciStpTopologyChanges
nnciStpTopologyChanges.description: This object indicates the number of times that the topology change flag has been set to true since the last bridge reset.

nnciStpTopologyChangeAck.name: nnciStpTopologyChangeAck
nnciStpTopologyChangeAck.description: This flag indicates whether the topology change acknowledge flag should be set in the next hello message generated on this interface. Setting this flag acknowledges the receipt of a topology change notification (TCN) from another bridge on the interface.

nnciStpInterfacePriority.name: nnciStpInterfacePriority
nnciStpInterfacePriority.description: This object is a user-settable priority assigned to each interface. The interface priority allows the network manager to indicate that a given interface should be preferentially used for forwarding messages. Interfaces with smaller numbers (higher priorities) are preferentially used for bridge traffic.

nnciStpInterfaceCost.name: nnciStpInterfaceCost
nnciStpInterfaceCost.description: This object indicates the relative cost of sending a frame out on a given interface. It is computed in the following manner. If nnciStpCostMultiplier is non-zero, then nnciStpInterfaceCost = (nnciStpCostMultiplier/100) * (10^9 / ifSpeed). If nnciStpCostMultiplier is zero, then nnciStpInterfaceCost = nnciStpUserAssignedCost. In this way, the cost of an interface can either track the bandwidth allocated, or be assigned a fixed value. Note that the value is not allowed to be zero.

nnciStpDesignatedBridge.name: nnciStpDesignatedBridge
nnciStpDesignatedBridge.description: This object specifies the designated bridge for the link (LAN or WAN) attached to the interface. Specifically, it is the id of the designated bridge. The designated bridge for a link is chosen as the bridge with the least-cost path to the root.

nnciStpDesignatedInterface.name: nnciStpDesignatedInterface
nnciStpDesignatedInterface.description: This object indicates the interface that the bridge given by nnciStpDesignatedBridge uses to send configuration messages over the link (LAN or WAN). Specifically, it is the id of the interface (i.e., the concatenation of the interface priority and the interface address). This object is of interest if the designated bridge has more than one interface connected to the link.

nnciStpDesignatedRoot.name: nnciStpDesignatedRoot
nnciStpDesignatedRoot.description: This object indicates who the designated bridge thinks is the root (i.e., what the value of nnciStpRoot is on the bridge given by nnciStpDesignateBridge). This object will only differ from nnciStpRoot when the topology of the spanning tree is changing.

nnciStpDesignatedCost.name: nnciStpDesignatedCost
nnciStpDesignatedCost.description: This object provides the cost of the cheapest path between nnciStpDesignatedBridge and nnciStpDesignatedRoot.

nnciStpConfigurationMessagePending.name: nnciStpConfigurationMessagePending
nnciStpConfigurationMessagePending.description: If this object is true, then a configuration BPDU has been queued for transmission due to the transmission of another configuration BPDU within the last second.

nnciStpAllowableDeviations.name: nnciStpAllowableDeviations
nnciStpAllowableDeviations.description: This object specifies those deviations from the 802.1d document that will be tolerated by the bridge. If the bit in the specified position is 1, then that deviation will be allowed.

nnciStpCostMultiplier.name: nnciStpCostMultiplier
nnciStpCostMultiplier.description: This object is the weight assigned to the default cost, expressed as a percentage. That is, a multiplier of 50 means the interface should have half its default cost as determined by its speed. See the description of nnciStpInterfaceCost for more details.

nnciStpUserAssignedCost.name: nnciStpUserAssignedCost
nnciStpUserAssignedCost.description: This object is used to determine the cost assigned to a interface. See the description of nnciStpInterfaceCost for the details.
